title.narrative: 2. QUALITY CHILD HEALTH SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Health's technical departments are better equipped to improve quality of integrated child health services, targeting preventable diseases in particular, at health care facilities and in the community., which contributes to Child Health, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, Women of childbearing age, pregnant women, newborns, boys and girls under age 5 years and adolescents use quality health services at health facilities and in communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Health?s technical departments are better equipped to improve quality of integrated child healthservices, targeting preventable diseases in particular, at health care facilities and in the community.

description.narrative: A polio vaccine catch-up campaign reached 1,980,983 children aged 3 to 5 years (104.37 per cent); this prevents them from a potential paralysis caused by the derivate poliovirus type 2 (cVDPV2 circulating in the country since 2020.; As of; week, 48, epidemiologic bulletin reported 1,265 cases of Acute Flaccid Paralysis among those; two cases; caused by cVDPV2. As of 31 October 2021, the administrative coverages were 98.9 per cent for Penta3 and 99.9; and 88.6 per cent for measles and rubella; vaccine first and second dose. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
